title: Joint Jammer Mitigation and Data Detection
summary: Joint jammer Mitigation and data Detection (JMD) is a novel MIMO jammer mitigation approach that estimates and removes interference subspace jointly with detecting legitimate transmit data. It addresses drawbacks of existing methods, such as train...
key_points: Eliminates dedicated training phase
Mitigates smart and dynamic multi-antenna jammers
Provides two JMD-type algorithms: SANDMAN and MAED
Demonstrated efficacy through extensive simulations

title:
Interplay between Security, Privacy and Trust in 6G-enabled Intelligent
  Transportation Systems
authors: Ahmed Danladi Abdullahi, Erfan Bahrami, Tooska Dargahi, Mohammed Al-Khalidi, Mohammad Hammoudeh
summary: This paper examines the security and privacy challenges of 6G-ITS, highlighting the need for a comprehensive security framework to address emerging threats. It discusses potential benefits of 6G technology in transportation, including improved com...
key_points: Security and privacy challenges in 6G-ITS
Comprehensive security framework needed
Potential benefits of 6G technology in transportation
Quantum technologies' role in enhancing security and introducing vulnerabilities

title:
Pioneering Scalable Prototyping for Mid-Band XL-MIMO Systems: Design and
  Implementation
authors: Jiachen Tian, Yu Han, Zhengtao Jin, Xi Yang, Jie Yang, Wankai Tang, Xiao Li, Wenjin Wang, Shi Jin
summary: This article discusses the mid-band frequency range as a key enabler for future communication systems, highlighting its potential to enhance throughput and support advanced functionalities. A real-time prototype system is designed and implemented,...
key_points: Mid-band XL-MIMO system design
Real-time prototype implementation
Supports multiuser communication with up to 12 users

title: Action Deviation-Aware Inference for Low-Latency Wireless Robots
authors: Jeyoung Park, Yeonsub Lim, Seungeun Oh, Jihong Park, Jinho Choi, Seong-Lyun Kim
summary: Proposed method reduces latency and transmission in distributed ML for AI applications like autonomous driving and robot manipulation by selectively skipping server operations based on action deviation.
key_points: Selective skipping improves uplink transmission and server operation
Action deviation-aware hybrid inference reduces latency by 33.32% and transmission by 40%
Improves task success rate to 97.03% compared to target model only inference
Reduces computational load on remote servers

title:
Compressed Multiband Sensing in FR3 Using Alternating Direction Method
  of Multipliers
authors: Dexin Wang, Isha Jariwala, Ahmad Bazzi, Sundeep Rangan, Theodore S. Rappaport, Marwa Chafii
summary: A novel framework for multiband sensing in 6G ISAC using ADMM-CMS is introduced, achieving higher spatial resolution and improved denoising compared to classical beamforming methods.
key_points: ADMM-CMS improves spatial resolution by 34 dB
Achieves 0.9 successful recovery probability with reduced delay errors
Outperforms separate compressed sensing on sub-bands in FR3
Suitable for large-scale structured optimization using ADMM algorithm

title: When Names Disappear: Revealing What LLMs Actually Understand About Code
authors: Cuong Chi Le, Minh V. T. Pham, Cuong Duc Van, Hoang N. Phan, Huy N. Phan, Tien N. Nguyen
summary: LLMs' code understanding relies on both structural semantics and human-interpretable naming. Removing naming cues degrades performance, revealing memorization shortcuts. A new benchmark reduces inflated performance gaps and assesses LLMs' genuine ...
key_points: LLMs rely on both structural semantics and naming for code understanding
Removing naming cues degrades performance and reveals memorization shortcuts
New benchmark (ClassEval-Obf) systematically suppresses naming cues while preserving behavior
ClassEval-Obf reduces inflated performance gaps and assesses genuine semantic reasoning

title:
Cache-to-Cache: Direct Semantic Communication Between Large Language
  Models
authors: Tianyu Fu, Zihan Min, Hanling Zhang, Jichao Yan, Guohao Dai, Wanli Ouyang, Yu Wang
summary: This article introduces Cache-to-Cache (C2C), a new paradigm for direct semantic communication between Large Language Models (LLMs). C2C improves response quality without increasing cache size, utilizing deep semantics from both models.
key_points: Direct semantic transfer between LLMs
Improved response quality
Faster latency with 2.0x speedup
Higher accuracy than individual models
Avoiding explicit text generation

title: Cheat-Penalised Quantum Weak Coin-Flipping
authors: Atul Singh Arora, Carl A. Miller, Mauro E. S. Morales, Jamie Sikora
summary: Researchers develop efficient quantum protocols for cheat-penalised weak coin-flipping, achieving near-perfect security with low round and space complexity.
key_points: New protocols outperform existing weak coin-flipping protocols in terms of security
Proocols achieve high security with minimal cheating penalty (0.01)
Optimization between bias reduction and round reduction possible with varying penalties
Technical contributions include extending point game-protocol correspondence and numerical algorithm for constructing approximate point games
Results enable secure quantum protocols for multiparty computation

title:
TPM-Based Continuous Remote Attestation and Integrity Verification for
  5G VNFs on Kubernetes
authors: Al Nahian Bin Emran, Rajendra Upadhyay, Rajendra Paudyal, Lisa Donnan, Duminda Wijesekera
summary: A TPM 2.0-based continuous remote attestation solution is presented for securing core 5G components deployed on Kubernetes, addressing security challenges and aligning with Zero Trust principles.
key_points: Lack of runtime integrity validation in current 5G security specifications
Introduction of a TPM 2.0-based continuous remote attestation solution using Linux Integrity Measurement Architecture (IMA) and Trusted Platform Module (TPM)
Per-pod integrity verification using an open-source Keylime framework
Real-time detection of unauthorized modifications and generation of detailed audit logs
Enhancing the resilience of 5G as critical infrastructure in multi-vendor and mission-critical scenarios

title:
Absence of quantum Darwinism as a resource in secure quantum
  communication and computation
authors: Bishal Kumar Das, Sourav Manna, Vaibhav Madhok
summary: This article discusses the emergence of classical world from quantum mechanics, highlighting the role of objectivity (quantum Darwinism) in cryptography and efficient classical simulation of quantum circuits. It provides a key ingredient for effic...
key_points: Quantum Darwinism enables efficient classical simulation
Concordant states provide a cryptographic advantage
Objectivity demarcates the quantum-classical border
Efficient simulation aligns with Hardy's boundary
